description: This chapter contrasts worldly wisdom with God's wisdom and explains how spiritual truths are revealed through the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: How did Paul come to the Corinthians when proclaiming the testimony about God?
options: Not with eloquence or human wisdom

questions.question: What did Paul resolve to know while he was with the Corinthians?
options: Nothing except Jesus Christ and him crucified
The laws of the new covenant

questions.question: In what condition did Paul come to the Corinthians?
options: In weakness with great fear and trembling

questions.question: How does Paul describe his message and preaching?
options: Not with wise and persuasive words, but with a demonstration of the Spirit's power

questions.question: On what did Paul want the Corinthians' faith to rest?
Among whom does Paul speak a message of wisdom?
What kind of wisdom does Paul NOT speak?
options: The wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age

questions.question: What wisdom does Paul declare?
options: God's wisdom, a mystery that has been hidden and that God destined for our glory before time began

questions.question: What would the rulers of this age not have done if they had understood God's wisdom?
How is it written about what God has prepared for those who love him?
options: What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, and what no human mind has conceived
It has been conceived in human minds

questions.question: How has God revealed his wisdom to us?
What does the Spirit search?
options: All things, even the deep things of God

questions.question: Who can know the thoughts of God?
options: No one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God

questions.question: What spirit have believers received?
options: The Spirit who is from God

questions.question: Why have we received the Spirit who is from God?
options: So that we may understand what God has freely given us

questions.question: How does Paul explain spiritual realities?
options: In words taught by human wisdom
With Spirit-taught words, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words

questions.question: How does the person without the Spirit view the things that come from the Spirit of God?
Why can't the person without the Spirit understand the things that come from the Spirit of God?
options: Because they are discerned only through the Spirit

questions.question: What does the person with the Spirit make judgments about?
Is the person with the Spirit subject to judgments by others?
options: No, such a person is not subject to merely human judgments
Yes, but only by other spiritual people

questions.question: What question does Paul ask in verse 16?
options: Who has known the mind of the Lord so as to instruct him?

questions.question: What do believers have according to the end of the chapter?
What did Paul proclaim to the Corinthians?
What demonstrated the truth of Paul's preaching?
How is God's wisdom described?
options: A mystery that has been hidden

questions.question: Who was crucified according to verse 8?
For whom has God prepared things?
Who searches all things?
What words does Paul use to explain spiritual realities?
When did God destine his wisdom for our glory?
options: Since the time of the apostles
